comments.commentBody: So a law professor on the NYT payroll says it's illegal to "skirt the law." How many law professors use radar detectors? The "concerned officials" who want to "regulate" have no more interest in protecting the public than Elmer Fudd. Protecting from what? Cleaner, newer cars with cheaper fares and polite drivers? No, uber-liberals, regulate simply means tax. Tax because their ilk can't spell "budget."
Why not allow the users to decide for themselves, rather than taking on the paternalistic tole of protecting them for a hefty fee (taxes) ?
The rules are only in place to perpetuate a corrupt monopolistic model, not to protect anyone.

The new monopoly simply replaces the old.  Many of these "tech" companies fooled people with dreams of altruism.  They are ruthless capitalist themselves too.  They just don't get haircuts as often and wear jeans and sneakers instead of suits.  Uber's ultimate goal is to put drivers out of business altogether with autonomous cars.

Innovation and filling a need justifies the 70B valuation...not to mention the profits as well.

I agree we need to deregulate the government and make it small again

uber is one of the good guys, they don't "seem" like one, they are
My fear is Trump will get on his cell phone between rounds of golf and order air strikes on North Korea

A scare article? Really?

The bigot Trump wants a massive increase in military spending at the expense of almost everything else and to that end he has been lying about the "horrible" state of our military. The NYTimes should not give the bigot the justification for his ridiculous claims.

Well, it's not really a "secret" anymore.

The Times needs to do a better job balancing the public's need to know with genuine national security imperatives.

The North Koreans don't need any help from us.

What is so ridiculous is that everyone is all in a tizzy because of one single solitary human being.  Take him out and be done with it.  If North Korea decides to become difficult, taking them out isn't.  There's a reason why God gave us H-bombs.

"The United States still does not have the ability to effectively counter the North Korean nuclear and missile programs. Those threats are far more resilient than many experts thought . . . ." Ah, the experts undermined the North Korean threat; they seem to have gotten it wrong a lot these days. That, my friends, is the Obama legacy. Castrating our nation's ability to fend off a nuclear strike by North Korea. If the USA can not defend itself against North Korea imagine its inability to counter a nuclear strike from Russia or China, nations will some serious nuclear firepower.  Do we have the capability to protect western Europe a Russian attack? Potentially protect Israel from Iran? This is why President Trump seeks increased military spending, to return America's military might to the levels before Obama and beyond. Thank you.
Please write FACTS not Fox/Trump propaganda......those days for you guys are over.
I would much rather support President Pence in efforts to thwart North Korea.
Just maybe Trump's (and Obama's before him) request for an increase in the defense budget isn't so outrageous.

We have more than enough military capability to destroy this wanna-be nuclear power or prevent it from doing some grave harm. It's not defense spending but will and imagination that are lacking. Especially from the regime in the north. We can't create that for them out of whole cloth, but we can encourage them to find the will and imagination in new ways. We don't have to see an aggressor now in a failing state with nothing to gain from aggression. The boys wearing stars and epaulets on both sides need to wake up and see that enough force has been tried, enough blood shed. We don't make the same tragic mistakes again.

When we speak about North Korea's nuclear program we are talking about Kim Jong-un's toxic toys.  To glean his paranoid intentions for his "gun collection" may be more important than how many he has or how far they can shoot.

Yes, absolutely. Sure, the government of North Korea (and every other country on the planet) will read something they already know. However, this the great thing about our society; a free press, which allows our people the same right (except for Top Secret (which this is not) to be made aware of many things.

To be clear, you KNOW North Korea and numerous other countries have strict control over what it's own people read and it is highly censured.

If there's any sense in which China is our enemy, this is it. It's not making cheap things, taking away jobs. It's allowing NK to proceed along this dangerous path. Why? What is in it for China? Hard to understand. If Canada were making threatening noises and parading nukes around the streets of Ottawa, the US would dam sure put a stop to it, with or without the rest of the world chiming in.
Interesting comment.....more likely Canada will have to "put a stop to it"..... "it" being any serious "threatening noises" & mess  that Trump will get the USA (& Canada ) involved in.

It’s incredible how GOP backers supported all out political war and obstructionism against the Obama Administration for 8-years; and now cry fowl if fire is returned by the Democrats. The hypocrisy of the GOP at the time was obvious, now it is stunning.

Totally lost on the GOP is that the party abandoned governing for the good of all the people long ago. If Trump and the GOP wish that we constructively work together for the good of the country and stop the partisan warfare, which they started, action speaks louder than words. The day Mr. Bluster, Confrontation and Chaos embraces this approach I think then, and only then, will Democrats respond in kind. Playing nice with this POTUS and his band of radicals whose goal is to dismantle the US Government is ludicrous.

It is with complete comfort and peace that I sit back with the understanding that we have elected a man that has shown he is very well equipped and prepared to handle such a difficult situation.

Wait.....what?

comments.userLocation: where I always hope to be
comments.commentBody: I'm betting we never heard about, "warfare declared and begun by [Republicans] to satisfy the demands of the base to undermine the President at ever turn and in every way," from you back when Obama was dealing with this same issue and others more pressing to the needs of people of this country, like healthcare, huh?  I'll also bet you loved McConnell back then.  But you tell me.  Trump is a big boy, now, since Tuesday, at least, and if he can't take the heat from the opposition, he needs to get out of the kitchen.  Today, would be fine with me.

The only real solution is love, peace and shared prosperity. The last is all this has ever been about with North Korea.

Don't worry about Trump contradicting himself; he does it six times daily, and doesn't care.

Once again, "The Times agreed to withhold details ...". If the NYT could gather this information, it should be publishing it, not acting as an arm of government as it has too many times in the past. News is what someone doesn't want published.
This article also fails to address other possible ways of dealing with North Korea, such as treating it as a real, if seriously problematic, state. Our US preference for laughing at a nation that has managed to build a nuclear weapons program -- and thus clearly is not simply a punchline for jokes -- closes off potential alternatives to force.
President Trump says Obama tapped his phone, he is confused, it is tapped on the Russian side of the conversation!
If China does indeed perceive things the way you assume, it should have acted long ago to let North Korea know that the development of such weapons is not to be allowed. It has not.

No I guess such basic strategy and decision making by our leaders should be secret and kept from the American public. They have no right to know or discuss it. Only let the public know what the leaders want them to know. Security above democracy.
Sounds like the reasoning used by the leaders of Russia, China and..North Korea!

That missile N. Korea tested a week ago is just what comes out of a nuclear submarine, where it pops up above the water then ignites.  That's why Kim is smiling, thinking how he's going to be visiting the East Coast.

Another leftover from Obama . Another unprecedented Obama victory !
The worst thing is to "outsource" USA responsibilities to a foe like China .
USA should not delegate her responsibilities .
Although the previous Administrations sold the outsourcing of USA responsibilities vis-a-vis NK as being the silver spoon, after decades of doing nothing concrete, we are in this situation.
What is funny, it was the best avenue of telling us of such Obama plan which ended on Trump's table . What else Obama has planned and awaits for media to disclose on Saturdays ?
